etymologies: Old English wrenna, of Germanic origin

definitions: a small short-winged songbird found chiefly in the New World.

notes.text: Family Troglodytidae: many genera and numerous species, in particular the very small Troglodytes troglodytes (winter wren), which has a short cocked tail and is the only wren that occurs the Old World

shortDefinitions: small short-winged songbird found chiefly in New World

definitions: any of a number of small songbirds that resemble the true wrens in size or appearance.
